name: accomplishment
trans: n. 成就；完成；技艺，技能

sentences.chinese: 这第一条引证出自1557年，而且它还将一位当时伟大的航海家和地理绘图者带入我们的视野。

sentences.chinese: 一尊大象雕塑

trans: n. 密封；印章；海豹；封条；标志 vt. 密封；盖章 vi. 猎海豹 n. (Seal)人名；(英)西尔

sentences.chinese: 文件上盖有州长办公室的章。

sentences.english: He broke the wax seal and unrolled the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他揭去封蜡，把纸卷展开。

sentences.english: The window was sealed shut.
sentences.chinese: 这扇窗户被封了起来。

detailed_translations.english: a mark that has a special design and shows the legal or official authority of a person or organization
to close an entrance or a container with something that stops air, water etc from coming in or out of it

name: stable
trans: adj. 稳定的，牢固的；稳重的，沉稳的；持久的；（化学术语）稳定的 n. 马厩；养马场；（属同一马主或驯马师的）一群赛马；（同一地方工作的）一批人，（同一公司生产的）系列产品；（提供相同训练的）组织，机构 v. 赶入马房，把（马）拴在马厩；（被）关在马厩 n. (Stable) （美、英、法）斯特布尔（人名）

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

name: trench
trans: n. 沟，沟渠；战壕；堑壕 vt. 掘沟 vi. 挖战壕；侵害 n. (Trench)人名；(英、西)特伦奇

sentences.english: Orders came that we should spade the trench in an hour.
sentences.chinese: 有命令要我们必须在一小时内挖好战壕。

sentences.english: From nine to eleven he planned to dig a hole, or trench, and possibly find something good to eat buried in the dirt.
sentences.chinese: 九点到十一点，他打算挖一个洞，或者一条小沟也行，没准儿还能从脏土里翻出什么好吃的呢。

sentences.english: The bridge lies like a trench in the fortress of the moat, which is shaped to blend in with the outlines of the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥就像是坐落在护城河中的一条沟渠，这种造型是为了使它与周围的风景融合在一起。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow hole dug into the surface of the ground

name: bough
trans: n. 大树枝 n. (Bough)人名；(英)博夫

sentences.english: I rested my fishing rod against a pine bough.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的鱼竿靠在松树的一个大树枝上。

detailed_translations.english: a main branch on a tree

name: castaway
trans: n. 被抛弃的人；坐船遇难者；漂流者 adj. 遭难的；被抛弃的

name: defenseless
trans: adj. 无防备的

sentences.english: Without Christ we are defenseless against the Devil, but with "the helmet of salvation" our minds are protected by God.
sentences.chinese: 没有基督，我们无力防御魔鬼的攻击；但有救恩的头盔，我们的心思便有神的保护。

sentences.english: They also suggest that the sounds may function to attract the attention of predators, in which case the intruder would be rather defenseless.
sentences.chinese: 同时，还指出，这种声音还会吸引来食肉动物，在这样的情况下，入侵者在防御上就会处于明显的弱势。

sentences.english: "Human beings were small, defenseless and vulnerable to predators, " says Barbara J. King, biological anthropologist at the College of William and Mary and author of Evolving God.
sentences.chinese: “人类对掠食者而言是弱小、无力防御与易受伤害的，”威廉学院生物人类学家、《进化之神》的作者芭芭拉.J.金说。

name: distracted
trans: v. （使）分心；转移（注意力）；（使）困惑（distract 的过去式及过去分词） adj. 注意力分散的；心烦意乱的

sentences.english: She had seemed curiously distracted.
sentences.chinese: 她不知为什么显得心不在焉。

detailed_translations.english: anxious and unable to think clearly

name: evergreen
trans: adj. 常绿的；经久不衰的 n. 常绿植物；经久不衰的人（或事物）

sentences.english: Holly, like ivy and mistletoe, is an evergreen.
sentences.chinese: 冬青与常春藤和槲寄生一样，也是一种常绿植物。

detailed_translations.english: a tree or bush that does not lose its leaves in winter
an evergreen tree or bush does not lose its leaves in winter

name: harvest
trans: n. 收获；产量；结果 vt. 收割；得到 vi. 收割庄稼

sentences.english: every year at harvest time
sentences.chinese: 每年在收获的季节

sentences.english: Plum growers are expecting a bumper harvest this year.
sentences.chinese: 种植李树的农民期盼着今年有个好收成。

detailed_translations.english: the time when crops are gathered from the fields, or the act of gathering them
to gather crops from the fields

name: commoner
trans: n. 平民；自费学生；下议院议员 n. (Commoner)人名；(英)康芒纳

sentences.english: It's only the second time a potential heir to the throne has married a commoner.
sentences.chinese: 这只是第二次王储与平民结婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平民；自费学生；下议院议员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is not a member of the  nobility

name: keep
trans: vt. 保持；经营；遵守；饲养 vi. 保持；继续不断 n. 保持；生计；生活费 n. (Keep)人名；(英)基普

sentences.english: The noise kept him awake.
sentences.chinese: 噪音使他一直醒着。

sentences.english: I was struggling to keep awake.
sentences.chinese: 我努力不让自己睡着。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in a particular state, condition, or position, or to make someone or something do this

name: moat
trans: n. 护城河；壕沟 vt. 将...围以壕沟

sentences.english: Certainly no one in the media would deny the attraction of living behind a deep moat, even if it is filled with sharks.
sentences.chinese: 当然，在媒体业，没有人会否认围在深深的护城河里面过日子的吸引力，即使那河里满是鲨鱼在游来游去。

sentences.english: The bridge lies like a trench in the fortress of the moat, which is shaped to blend in with the outlines of the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥就像是坐落在护城河中的一条沟渠，这种造型是为了使它与周围的风景融合在一起。

sentences.english: It's a shame our particular moat, the ashram of Pray, is so exhausting, because in the Love section Bardem proves himself a worthy castle.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我们急缺实际的护城河，祈祷的场所，因为在爱这部分里，巴登证明了自己就是一座有价值的城堡。

detailed_translations.english: a deep wide hole, usually filled with water, dug around a castle as a defence

name: noble
trans: adj. 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的 n. 贵族 vt. 抓住；逮捕 n. (Noble)人名；(英、法、意)诺布尔；(西)诺夫莱；(阿拉伯)努布莱

sentences.english: It’s very noble of you to spend all your weekends helping the old folk.
sentences.chinese: 你心地真好，周末的时间全都用来帮助老人。

sentences.english: noble ideals
sentences.chinese: 崇高的理想

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的
detailed_translations.english: morally good or generous in a way that is admired
a member of the highest social class with a title such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’

trans: n. 炮塔；角楼；小塔；攻城用的冲车 n. 防御塔（游戏《英雄联盟》中的防御建筑）

sentences.english: Drop a grenade when a turret opens, but beware of bullets being fired at you.
sentences.chinese: 当角楼打开的时候，扔出手榴弹，一定要注意躲避射向你的子弹。

detailed_translations.english: a small tower on a large building, especially a  castle

trans: vi. 爬行；蔓延；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩 n. 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者；非玩家控制的小兵（游戏术语）

sentences.chinese: 他蹑手蹑脚地回楼上，尽量避开那些嘎吱作响的梯级。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；蔓延；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩
detailed_translations.english: if something such as an insect, small animal, or car creeps, it moves slowly and quietly

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者

name: echo
trans: vt. 反射；重复 vi. 随声附和；发出回声 n. 回音；效仿

sentences.english: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

sentences.english: ‘He's gone! ’ Viv echoed.
sentences.chinese: “他去了！”维夫重复道。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
to repeat what someone else has just said

trans: n. 数字；人物；图形；价格；（人的）体形；画像 vi. 计算；出现；扮演角色 vt. 计算；认为；描绘；象征

sentences.english: Reform now figures high on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，改革是当务之急。

detailed_translations.english: to be an important part of a process, event, or situation, or to be included in something

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；人物；算术；体型，风姿；轮廓；画像，塑像；图，图形
detailed_translations.english: the activity of adding, multiplying etc numbers

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算； 认为， 猜想
detailed_translations.english: to form a particular opinion after thinking about a situation

name: fork
trans: n. 叉；餐叉；耙 vt. 叉起；使成叉状 vi. 分叉；分歧 n. (Fork)人名；(英、德)福克

sentences.chinese: 把刀叉摆放在桌子上。

detailed_translations.english: a tool you use for picking up and eating food, with a handle and three or four points
to put food into your mouth or onto a plate using a fork

name: gorge
trans: n. 峡谷；胃；暴食；咽喉；障碍物 vt. 使吃饱；吞下；使扩张 vi. 拚命吃；狼吞虎咽 n. (Gorge)人名；(西)戈赫；(法)戈尔热

sentences.english: I could spend each day gorging on chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 我可以将每一天都花在狂吃巧克力上。

detailed_translations.english: If you gorge on something or gorge yourself on it, you eat lots of it in a very greedy way

name: passage
trans: n. 一段（文章）；走廊；通路；通过；旅程，行程；船费 vi. 通过通道 n. (Passage) （美）帕西奇（人名）

sentences.english: My office is just along the passage.
sentences.chinese: 我的办公室就在过道旁边。

sentences.english: We walked down a narrow passage to the back of the building.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着一条狭窄的通道来到大楼的后面。

sentences.english: an underground passage
sentences.chinese: 地下通道

sentences.english: The bridge isn’t strong enough to allow the passage of heavy vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 那座桥不够坚固，无法让重型车辆通过。

detailed_translations.english: a way through something

name: boycott
trans: v. 联合抵制；拒绝购买；拒绝参加 n. 联合抵制 n. (Boycott) 博伊科特（人名）

sentences.english: We boycott all products tested on animals.
sentences.chinese: 我们抵制所有拿动物做试验的产品。

sentences.english: They are now trying to organize a boycott.
sentences.chinese: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

name: condition
trans: n. 条件；情况；环境；身份 vt. 决定；使适应；使健康；以…为条件

sentences.english: Profits increased by £1.5m, despite the difficult economic conditions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管经济形势不佳，利润还是增长了150万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

name: migrant
trans: n. （为工作）移居者；候鸟；流动季节工 adj. 有迁徙习性的

sentences.english: The government divides asylum seekers into economic migrants and genuine refugees.
sentences.chinese: 政府将寻求政治庇护的人划分为经济移民和真正的难民。

detailed_translations.chinese: 移居者， 移民； 候鸟， 迁移动物

name: organize
trans: vt. 组织；使有系统化；给予生机；组织成立工会等 vi. 组织起来；成立组织

sentences.english: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.chinese: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.english: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.chinese: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.english: We are learning about how genes are organized.

name: strike

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

name: fizz
trans: v. 发嘶嘶声；起泡沫；劈啪作响；有活力，显示兴奋 n. 气泡；嘶嘶声；劈啪声；充气饮料；兴奋，活力

sentences.english: I wonder if there's any fizz left in the lemonade.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道这柠檬汽水中还有没有气泡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴奋，活力；嘶嘶声；充气饮料
detailed_translations.english: Fizz is also a noun

detailed_translations.chinese: 显示兴奋；发嘶嘶声；起泡沫

name: moisture
trans: n. 水分；湿度；潮湿；降雨量

sentences.english: Plants use their roots to absorb moisture from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物利用根从土壤中吸收水分。

sentences.english: Your skin’s moisture content varies according to weather conditions.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤的水分含量随着天气状况而变化。

detailed_translations.english: small amounts of water that are present in the air, in a substance, or on a surface

name: oasis
trans: n. 绿洲；舒适的地方；令人宽慰的事物 n. (Oasis)人名；(英)奥西斯

sentences.english: The immaculately tended gardens are an oasis in the midst of Cairo's urban sprawl.
sentences.chinese: 那些打理得非常整洁的花园是杂乱扩张的开罗市区中的一片绿洲。

detailed_translations.english: a place with water and trees in a desert

name: recipe
trans: n. 食谱；[临床] 处方；秘诀；烹饪法

sentences.english: a recipe book
sentences.chinese: 一本烹饪书

detailed_translations.english: a set of instructions for cooking a particular type of food

name: terminal
trans: n. 航空站；终点站；终端机；线接头；末端；晚期病人 adj. 晚期的；无可挽回的；末端的；终点的；期末的；（花朵等）顶升的

sentences.english: a terminal branch of a tree
sentences.chinese: 树顶枝条

sentences.english: terminal examinations (= at the end of a course, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 期终考试

sentences.english: the airport’s passenger terminal
sentences.chinese: 机场航站楼

detailed_translations.english: at the end of sth

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔飞机、公共汽车、轮船客运或货物运输的〕集散站，终点站
detailed_translations.english: a big building where people wait to get onto planes, buses, or ships, or where goods are loaded

name: dodge
trans: v. 躲开；迅速让开；逃避；按变换序列鸣钟；（冲洗或放大时）局部遮光 n. 闪躲；逃避的诡计；鸣钟的变序 n. (Dodge) （美）道奇（人名）

sentences.english: He ran across the courtyard, dodging a storm of bullets.
sentences.chinese: 他跑过院子，躲避雨点般的子弹。

detailed_translations.english: to move quickly to avoid someone or something
to deliberately avoid discussing something or doing something

detailed_translations.chinese: 托辞， 伎俩； 躲闪， 躲避
detailed_translations.english: something dishonest that is done to avoid a rule or law

name: gallop
trans: n. 疾驰；飞奔 vi. 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说 vt. 使飞跑；迅速运输 n. (Gallop)人名；(英)盖洛普

sentences.english: I was forced to attempt a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 我被迫尝试一次骑马疾驰。

detailed_translations.english: a very fast speed

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说
detailed_translations.english: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together

name: graze
trans: vt. 放牧；擦伤 vi. 吃草；擦伤 n. 放牧；轻擦

sentences.english: fields where they used to graze their sheep
sentences.chinese: 他们过去放羊的田野

detailed_translations.english: if an animal grazes, or if you graze it, it eats grass that is growing
to accidentally break the surface of your skin by rubbing it against something
a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

name: thoroughbred
trans: adj. 纯种的，纯血的；优秀的，一流的；受过严格训练的 n. 纯种马，纯血马；优秀的人，一流的东西；受过严格训练的人

detailed_translations.chinese: 受过严格训练的人；良种动物
良种的；受过严格训练的；优秀的

name: trot
trans: n. （人）慢跑；马小跑的步态；小跑的马蹄声；刚学步的小孩；老太婆；腹泻；（学生作弊用的）译文对照本 vi. （马）小跑；（人）慢跑；快步走 vt. 使小跑；使快步走

sentences.english: Alan took the reins and the small horse started trotting.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住缰绳，小马开始慢跑起来。

sentences.english: Our horses slowed to a trot.
sentences.chinese: 我们的马减速慢跑。

sentences.english: She broke into a trot (= started running slowly ) and hurried on ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 她突然小跑起来，赶到我们前头。

detailed_translations.english: if a horse trots, it moves fairly quickly with each front leg moving at the same time as the opposite back leg
the movement of a horse at trotting speed

name: retina

sentences.english: Consider one of the difficulties: every time we move our eyes, the image on our retina moves.
sentences.chinese: 比如困难之一就是：每当我们的眼球移动时，视网膜上的影像也在移动。

sentences.english: There are sensory neurons, which take information from the world so as you see me, for instance, there are neurons firing from your retina sending signals to your brain.
sentences.chinese: 感觉神经元,负责收集外界信息,比如,当你看到我的时候,视网膜上的神经元会产生神经冲动,将刺激信号传递到你的大脑

sentences.english: A tiny electronic pad is placed onto the retina of one eye, so that the electrodes are in direct contact with the ganglion cells.
sentences.chinese: 一个微小的电子衬垫被放置在单侧眼睛的视网膜上，这样电极就可以与神经节细胞直接接触了。

detailed_translations.english: the area at the back of your eye that receives light and sends an image of what you see to your brain

name: tissue
trans: n. 组织；纸巾；薄纱；一套 vt. 饰以薄纱；用化妆纸揩去

sentences.english: ...a small package wrapped in tissue paper.
sentences.chinese: …一个小包裹，用薄棉纸包着。

sentences.english: As we age we lose muscle tissue.
sentences.chinese: 随着年纪的增大，我们会失去一些肌肉组织。

detailed_translations.english: light thin paper used for wrapping, packing etc

name: wavelength
trans: n. [物] 波长

sentences.english: Sunlight consists of different wavelengths of radiation.
sentences.chinese: 阳光由波长不同的射线组成。

detailed_translations.english: the size of a radio wave used to broadcast a radio signal

name: bleaching
trans: v. （使）漂白，晒白；（使）变成淡色；（使）失去活力；（使）失去实质内容；用漂白剂给（排水管、水槽等）清洗（bleach 的现在分词）

name: dissolve
trans: vt. 使溶解；使分解；使液化 vi. 溶解；解散；消失 n. 叠化画面；画面的溶暗

sentences.english: Stir until the sugar dissolves.
sentences.chinese: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

detailed_translations.english: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it

name: fragile
trans: adj. 脆的；易碎的

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: skeleton
trans: n. 骨架，骨骼；纲要；骨瘦如柴的人 adj. 骨骼的；骨瘦如柴的；概略的

sentences.english: We agreed on a skeleton outline of the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 我们给提案商定了一个基本框架。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骨架，骨骼；纲要；骨瘦如柴的人
detailed_translations.english: the most important parts of something, to which more detail can be added later

detailed_translations.chinese: 骨骼的；骨瘦如柴的；概略的

name: tropical
trans: adj. 热带的；热情的；酷热的

sentences.english: the tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.english: tropical fruit
sentences.chinese: 热带水果

detailed_translations.english: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world

name: altar
trans: n. 祭坛；圣坛；圣餐台 n. (Altar)人名；(法、塞、罗)阿尔塔

sentences.english: a crucifix above the high altar
sentences.chinese: 主圣坛上方的耶稣受难像

sentences.english: The victim was tied to a sacrificial altar.
sentences.chinese: 牺牲被绑在祭坛上。

detailed_translations.english: a holy table or surface used in religious ceremonies

name: ancestor
trans: n. 始祖，祖先；被继承人

sentences.english: My ancestors were French.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖先是法国人。

detailed_translations.english: a member of your family who lived a long time ago

name: cemetery
trans: n. 墓地；公墓

sentences.english: Her father was laid in a cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲安葬在一处公墓。

sentences.english: The body was interred at that cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 尸体下葬在那个公墓。

sentences.english: He rests in a cemetery in the western suburbs of Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 他长眠于北京西郊的一个公墓中。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land, usually not belonging to a church, in which dead people are buried

name: honor
trans: n. 荣誉；信用；头衔 vt. 尊敬（等于honour）；给…以荣誉

sentences.english: For the French team, winning tomorrow’s game is a matter of national honor.
sentences.chinese: 对法国队来说，打赢明天的比赛事关国家荣誉。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

name: spirit
trans: n. 精神；心灵；情绪；志气；烈酒 vt. 鼓励；鼓舞；诱拐

sentences.english: His spirits were so low (= he was so sad ) that he refused to answer his phone.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪非常低落，连电话也不愿接。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神；心灵；情绪；志气；烈酒
detailed_translations.english: the qualities that make someone live the way they do, and make them different from other people

name: tradition
trans: n. 惯例，传统；传说

sentences.english: the traditions of South East Asia
sentences.chinese: 东南亚的传统

sentences.english: the tradition that the eldest son inherits the property
sentences.chinese: 长子继承家产的传统

sentences.english: By tradition, it’s the bride’s parents who pay for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 根据传统习俗，婚礼的费用由新娘的父母承担。

detailed_translations.english: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time, or these beliefs, customs etc in general

name: earthquake
trans: n. 地震；大动荡

sentences.english: An earthquake measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale struck southern California on June 28.
sentences.chinese: 6月28日加州南部地区发生了里氏6.1级地震。

sentences.english: The city is in an earthquake zone.
sentences.chinese: 该市位于地震带。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden shaking of the earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage

name: fault
trans: n. 故障；[地质] 断层；错误；缺点；毛病；（网球等）发球失误 vi. 弄错；产生断层 vt. （通常用于疑问句或否定句）挑剔

sentences.english: I’m really sorry - it’s all my fault.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep well that night, but it was my own fault .
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我没有睡好，但这是我自己的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

name: magma
trans: n. [地质] 岩浆；糊剂 n. (Magma)人名；(英)马格马

sentences.english: The volcano threw new showers of magma and ash into the air.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山向空气中喷发了新的岩浆和火山灰。

detailed_translations.english: hot melted rock below the surface of the Earth

name: plate
trans: n. 碟；金属板；金属牌；感光底片 vt. 电镀；给…装甲 n. (Plate)人名；(英、德、俄、西、意、瑞典)普拉特

sentences.english: The plates were piled high with rice.
sentences.chinese: 盘子里都堆满了米饭。

sentences.english: a beautiful necklace, plated with 22-carat gold
sentences.chinese: 一条漂亮的22开镀金项链

detailed_translations.english: flat and usually round dish that you eat from or serve food on
to be covered with a thin covering of gold or silver

name: tsunami
trans: n. 海啸

sentences.english: You see this in the faces of tsunami and earthquake survivors on television.
sentences.chinese: 你能从电视上海啸和地震的生还者的脸上看到这点。

sentences.english: They urged other town residents unaffected by the quake and tsunami to do the same.
sentences.chinese: 他们敦促其他没有受到地震和海啸影响的城镇居民也这样做。

sentences.english: But I am lucky because we did get a little bit of the tsunami but nothing like what they got up north.
sentences.chinese: 但我算是幸运的因为我们这只受到了海啸很小的侵害远不及北方所受到的那样。

detailed_translations.english: a very large wave, caused by extreme conditions such as an  earthquake  , which can cause a lot of damage when it reaches land

name: volcano
trans: n. 火山

sentences.english: Pompeii was destroyed when the volcano erupted in 79 AD.
sentences.chinese: 庞贝城于公元79年在火山爆发中毁灭。

detailed_translations.english: a mountain with a large hole at the top, through which lava is sometimes forced out

name: accomplish
trans: vt. 完成；实现；达到

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: adolescent
trans: adj. 青春期的；未成熟的 n. 青少年

sentences.english: It is important that an adolescent boy should have an adult in whom he can confide.
sentences.chinese: 一个青春期男孩应该有一个他能倾吐心声的成年人，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 青春期的； 青少年的
detailed_translations.english: Adolescent is used to describe young people who are no longer children but who have not yet become adults. It also refers to their behaviour.
a young person, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, who is developing into an adult

name: dilemma
trans: n. 困境；进退两难；两刀论法

sentences.english: a moral dilemma
sentences.chinese: 道德上进退两难的窘境

sentences.english: This placed Robert Kennedy in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

name: extraordinary
trans: adj. 非凡的；特别的；离奇的；特派的

sentences.english: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
sentences.chinese: 这费了相当多的功夫。

sentences.english: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.english: The U.S. has called for an extraordinary emergency meeting of the UN Human Rights Commission to examine the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国已要求召开一次联合国人权委员特别紧急会议来调查这次危机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非同寻常的；特别的（会议）
detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

name: possibility
trans: n. 可能性；可能发生的事物

sentences.english: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

detailed_translations.english: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

name: responsibility
trans: n. 责任，职责；义务

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

name: cooperative
trans: adj. 合作的；合作社的 n. 合作社

sentences.english: He was doing his best to be cooperative.
sentences.chinese: 他在尽全力配合。

sentences.english: a cooperative witness
sentences.chinese: 肯配合的目击者

detailed_translations.english: willing to cooperate

name: countryside
trans: n. 农村，乡下；乡下的全体居民

sentences.english: The house had lovely views over open countryside .
sentences.chinese: 这房子望出去是开阔的乡村美景。

detailed_translations.chinese: 农村，乡下；乡下的全体居民
detailed_translations.english: land that is outside cities and towns

name: energetic
trans: adj. 精力充沛的；积极的；有力的

sentences.english: an energetic man
sentences.chinese: 精力旺盛的男子

sentences.english: an energetic drive to get more customers
sentences.chinese: 争取更多客户的十足干劲

detailed_translations.english: having or needing a lot of energy or determination

name: fidgety
trans: adj. 不安的，烦躁的；难以取悦的

sentences.english: The boys get fidgety if they can’t play outside.
sentences.chinese: 要是不能出去玩，这些男孩子就会坐立不安。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坐立不安的，烦躁不安的
detailed_translations.english: unable to stay still, especially because of being bored or nervous

name: ridiculous
trans: adj. 可笑的；荒谬的

sentences.english: That’s a ridiculous idea!
sentences.chinese: 那主意很荒唐！

sentences.english: Don’t be ridiculous!
sentences.chinese: 别傻了！

sentences.english: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
sentences.chinese: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

detailed_translations.english: very silly or unreasonable

name: significant
trans: adj. 重大的；有效的；有意义的；值得注意的；意味深长的 n. 象征；有意义的事物

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

name: audience
trans: n. 观众；听众；读者；接见；正式会见；拜会

sentences.english: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.english: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

detailed_translations.english: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work

name: competition
trans: n. 竞争；比赛，竞赛

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: contestant
trans: n. 竞争者；争辩者

sentences.english: Column 5 displays only one contestant—the winner of the entire tournament.
sentences.chinese: 第 5 列只显示了一个竞争者 — 整个锦标赛的获胜者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who competes in a contest

name: international
trans: adj. 国际的；国际通用的 n. 国际体育比赛（选手）；外国人 n. (International) 共产国际（组织）

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

name: lyrics
trans: n. 歌词；抒情诗（lyric的复数）

sentences.english: ...Kurt Weill's Broadway opera with lyrics by Langston Hughes.
sentences.chinese: …由兰斯顿·休斯作词的库尔特·韦尔的百老汇歌剧。

detailed_translations.english: The lyrics of a song are its words

name: trophy
trans: n. 奖品；战利品；纪念品 vt. 用战利品装饰 adj. 显示身份的；有威望的 n. (Trophy)人名；(法)特罗菲

sentences.english: A lion’s head was among the trophies of his African trip.
sentences.chinese: 他非洲之行的战利品之一是个狮头。

detailed_translations.english: something that you keep to prove your success in something, especially in war or hunting

name: extreme
trans: adj. 极端的；极度的；偏激的；尽头的 n. 极端；末端；最大程度；极端的事物

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

name: mammal
trans: n. [脊椎] 哺乳动物

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: pigment
trans: n. [物][生化] 色素；颜料 vt. 给…着色 vi. 呈现颜色

sentences.english: Melanin is the dark brown pigment of the hair, skin and eyes.
sentences.chinese: 黑色素是头发、皮肤以及眼睛中的深棕色色素。

sentences.english: The artist Sandy Lee uses natural pigments in her work.
sentences.chinese: 画家桑迪·李在她的作品中使用天然颜料。

detailed_translations.english: a natural substance that makes skin, hair, plants etc a particular colour

name: temperament
trans: n. 气质，性情，性格；急躁

sentences.english: His impulsive temperament regularly got him into difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他容易冲动的性格经常使他陷入困境。

detailed_translations.english: the emotional part of someone’s character, especially how likely they are to be happy, angry etc

name: territory
trans: n. 领土，领域；范围；地域；版图

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: transparent
trans: adj. 透明的；显然的；坦率的；易懂的

sentences.english: a transparent plastic container
sentences.chinese: 透明的塑料容器

sentences.english: Am I that transparent (= are my intentions that obvious) ?
sentences.chinese: 我就那么没有城府？

detailed_translations.english: allowing you to see through it

name: assassinate
trans: vt. 暗杀；行刺

sentences.english: a plot to assassinate the President
sentences.chinese: 刺杀总统的阴谋

detailed_translations.english: to murder an important person

name: discrimination
trans: n. 歧视；区别，辨别；识别力

sentences.english: laws to prevent discrimination
sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

detailed_translations.english: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: humanitarian
trans: adj. 人道主义的；博爱的；基督凡人论的 n. 人道主义者；慈善家；博爱主义者；基督凡人论者

sentences.english: And on each of those issues we have said that we would consider that and, in fact, have provided some humanitarian support.
sentences.chinese: 对于每一件这样的事情，我们都说过，我们将会对此进行考虑，事实上，我们向他们提供了人道主义援助。

sentences.english: But part of trying to do what is right for the Burmese people is to provide humanitarian assistance in this time of extreme need.
sentences.chinese: 但是，对缅甸人民来说，正确的行动部分是为他们提供人道主义援助，而在目前这个时刻更是极端的需要”。

sentences.english: But otherwise, it is best left to the humanitarian experts, who will be there after you are gone and therefore need to preserve their independence and their impartiality.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果不能，最好将这些任务留给人道主义专家，这些专家在部队撤退之后仍将留在那，因此需要保持他们的独立和公正。

name: immunization
trans: n. 免疫

name: influential
trans: adj. 有影响的；有势力的 n. 有影响力的人物

sentences.english: He had influential friends.
sentences.chinese: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

sentences.english: a highly influential art magazine
sentences.chinese: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

name: polio
trans: n. 小儿麻痹症（等于poliomyelitis）；脊髓灰质炎

sentences.english: Gladys was crippled by polio at the age of 3.
sentences.chinese: 格拉迪丝3岁时因小儿麻痹症而瘸了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小儿麻痹症（等于poliomyelitis）；脊髓灰质炎
detailed_translations.english: a serious infectious disease of the nerves in the  spine  , that often results in someone being permanently unable to move particular muscles

name: gunpowder
trans: n. 火药；有烟火药

sentences.english: Damp gunpowder will not fire.
sentences.chinese: 潮湿的火药不会起火。

detailed_translations.english: an explosive substance used in bombs and  fireworks

name: leader
trans: n. 领导者；首领；指挥者 n. (Leader)人名；(英)利德

sentences.english: the largest ever gathering of world leaders
sentences.chinese: 全世界领导人史无前例的大聚会

detailed_translations.english: the person who directs or controls a group, organization, country etc

name: mortar
trans: n. 灰泥，砂浆；迫击炮，迫击炮弹；研钵，臼 v. 用灰泥涂抹，结合；用迫击炮攻击（或袭击）

sentences.english: So they had bricks for stone and asphalt for mortar.
sentences.chinese: 于是他们用砖代替石头，沥青代替灰泥。

sentences.english: Even the flimsiest of science fiction or the nastiest of horror stories or the most intricate of spy novels uses this as the mortar to bond together its narrative.
sentences.chinese: 即便是最天花乱坠的科幻小说、最荒唐无稽的恐怖小说和最错综复杂的间谍小说也都用这些元素作为粘合叙述的灰泥。

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of  cement  or  lime  , and sand and water, used in building for holding bricks or stones together

name: pyrotechnics
trans: n. 烟火制造术；烟火使用；各种烟火

name: apprehensive
trans: adj. 忧虑的；不安的；敏悟的；知晓的

sentences.english: Some had apprehensive looks on their faces.
sentences.chinese: 有些人面带愁容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧虑的；不安的；敏悟的；知晓的
detailed_translations.english: worried or nervous about something that you are going to do, or about the future

name: flutter
trans: v. 飘动；（鸟或昆虫）鼓翼；飞来飞去；（心脏等）怦怦乱跳；（人）奔忙 n. 振动；（非正式）小赌注；紧张兴奋；（心脏的）怦怦乱跳；扑动；（重放录音的）颤振

sentences.english: Dead leaves fluttered slowly to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 枯叶缓缓飘落到地上。

sentences.english: The flag fluttered in the light breeze.
sentences.chinese: 旗帜在微风中飘动。

detailed_translations.english: to make small gentle movements in the air

name: nervousness
trans: n. 神经质；[心理] 神经过敏；紧张不安

detailed_translations.chinese: 神经质；[心理] 神经过敏；紧张不安

name: reluctance
trans: n. [电磁] 磁阻；勉强；不情愿

sentences.english: Wells finally agreed, but with reluctance.
sentences.chinese: 韦尔斯最终同意了，但很勉强。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is unwilling to do something, or when they do something slowly to show that they are not very willing

name: trudge
trans: vi. 跋涉；步履艰难地走 vt. 跋涉 n. 长途跋涉；沉重的步伐

sentences.english: We trudged home through the snow.
sentences.chinese: 我们艰难地穿过雪地走回了家。

sentences.english: We were reluctant to start the long trudge home.
sentences.chinese: 我们不情愿的开始长途跋涉回家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跋涉；步履艰难地走，费力地走
detailed_translations.english: to walk with slow heavy steps, especially because you are tired or it is difficult to walk
Trudge is also a noun

name: fossil
trans: n. 化石；僵化的事物；顽固不化的人 adj. 化石的；陈腐的，守旧的

sentences.english: fossils of early reptiles
sentences.chinese: 早期爬行动物的化石

sentences.english: Marine sponges have a long fossil record (= their development has been recorded over a long period ).
sentences.chinese: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

name: imprint
trans: n. 印记；痕迹；特征；版本说明 vt. 加特征；刻上记号

sentences.english: She could see the imprint of her fingers on his pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她可以看到自己的手指在他苍白的脸上留下的印痕。

sentences.english: As I arrived, the shimmering skyline of domes and minarets was imprinted on my memory.
sentences.chinese: 当我到达时，穹顶和尖塔形成的泛着微光的空中轮廓线铭刻在我的记忆中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 印记；痕迹；特征；版本说明
detailed_translations.english: the mark left by an object being pressed into or onto something
When something is imprinted on your memory, it is firmly fixed in your memory so that you will not forget it

name: investigate
trans: v. 调查；研究

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: petrified
trans: adj. 惊呆的；目瞪口呆的 v. 使石化；变僵硬；发呆（petrify的过去分词）

name: webbed
trans: adj. 有蹼的；蜘蛛网状的 v. 用蹼将…连接；结网；使落入圈套（web的过去分词）

name: conflict
trans: n. 冲突，矛盾；斗争；争执 vi. 冲突，抵触；争执；战斗

sentences.english: the threat of industrial conflict in the coalfields
sentences.chinese: 煤田发生劳资纠纷的风险

sentences.english: Marx points out the potential conflicts below the surface of society.
sentences.chinese: 马克思指出了隐藏在社会表层之下的潜在矛盾。

sentences.english: His views on the literal truth of the Bible brought him into conflict with other Christian leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持《圣经》字面真理的观点使他与其他的基督教领袖发生了冲突。

sentences.english: Doctors exercise considerable power and often come into conflict with politicians.
sentences.chinese: 医生行使很大的权力，常常和政客们发生冲突。

sentences.english: a lawyer specializing in conflict resolution
sentences.chinese: 专门解决纠纷的律师

detailed_translations.english: a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries etc

name: fairness
trans: n. 公平；美好；清晰；顺利性

sentences.english: the basic fairness of the judicial system
sentences.chinese: 司法制度的基本公正性

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being fair

name: inspire
trans: vt. 激发；鼓舞；启示；产生；使生灵感

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: nonviolence
trans: n. 非暴力；非暴力事件

name: political
trans: adj. 政治的；党派的

sentences.english: a monarch without political power
sentences.chinese: 没有政治权力的君主

sentences.english: He was a political prisoner (= one who was put in prison because he was thought to be harmful to the state) .
sentences.chinese: 他曾是个政治犯。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the state, government or public affairs

name: protest
trans: n. 抗议，反对；（多来自公证人）拒付证书 v. 抗议，反对；坚决表示，断言；拒付

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

name: chisel
trans: n. 凿子 v. 雕，刻，凿；（非正式）欺骗

sentences.english: He is chipping away at a block marble with a chisel.
sentences.chinese: 他正在用凿子在大理石上不停地凿。

sentences.english: Armed with only a chisel, a chainsaw and a hammer, the 32-year-old moved his family to a hillside in Wales and started digging.
sentences.chinese: 仅用凿子，电锯和锤子这些工具，这位32岁的男子举家搬到了位于威尔士的一个山坡，并开始继续挖凿（房子）。

detailed_translations.english: a metal tool with a sharp edge, used to cut wood or stone

name: flute
trans: n. 长笛；【工程设计】(刀具的)出屑槽 vt. 用长笛吹奏 vi. 吹长笛

sentences.english: The boy trilled on a flute.
sentences.chinese: 男孩在长笛上吹颤音。

sentences.english: He played a nice tune on the flute.
sentences.chinese: 他吹奏了一首优美的笛子曲。

sentences.english: A pipe organ gives much more volume than a violin or flute.
sentences.chinese: 管风琴发出的音量比小提琴或笛子都大。

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a thin pipe, that you play by holding it across your lips, blowing over a hole, and pressing down buttons with your fingers

name: gale
trans: n. [气象] 大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵 n. (Gale)人名；(西、葡、塞)加莱；(缅)格礼；(英)盖尔

sentences.english: a severe gale
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风

detailed_translations.chinese: [气象] 大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵
detailed_translations.english: a very strong wind

name: golden
trans: adj. 金色的，黄金般的；珍贵的；金制的 n. (Golden)人名；(英、法、罗、德、瑞典)戈尔登

sentences.english: golden hair
sentences.chinese: 金发

sentences.english: golden sand
sentences.chinese: 金色的沙

sentences.english: He wasted a golden opportunity when he missed from the penalty spot.
sentences.chinese: 他罚球没有命中，浪费了一个绝佳的机会。

detailed_translations.english: having a bright yellow colour like gold

name: stagger
trans: vt. 蹒跚；使交错；使犹豫 vi. 蹒跚；犹豫 n. 蹒跚；交错安排 adj. 交错的；错开的

sentences.english: He managed to stagger home.
sentences.chinese: 他好不容易才蹒跚着走回家。

sentences.english: She staggered back a step.
sentences.chinese: 她踉跄着后退了一步。

sentences.english: The old man staggered drunkenly to his feet.
sentences.chinese: 老汉醉醺醺地踉跄着站了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to walk or move unsteadily, almost falling over
to make someone feel very surprised or shocked
an unsteady movement of someone who is having difficulty in walking

name: burrow
trans: v. 挖地洞，挖通道；依偎；挖穿；钻入；（使）……钻到……下面；（在……里）搜寻；深入查询 n. （动物的，尤指兔子挖的）洞穴，地洞 n. (Burrow) （美）伯罗（人名）

sentences.english: Normally timid, they rarely stray far from their burrows.
sentences.chinese: 它们通常很胆小，极少远离自己的洞穴。

sentences.english: The larvae burrow into cracks in the floor.
sentences.chinese: 幼虫钻进地板的裂缝中。

detailed_translations.english: a passage in the ground made by an animal such as a rabbit or  fox  as a place to live
If an animal burrows into the ground or into a surface, it moves through it by making a tunnel or hole

name: molt
trans: vi. 脱毛；换毛 n. 换毛；脱皮；换毛期 vt. 脱毛；换毛 n. (Molt)人名；(德、捷)莫尔特

sentences.english: Like other penguins, it undergoes an annual molt, replacing all its feathers in a few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 和其他企鹅一样，它也经历一年一次的脱毛，在几周时间里替换掉所有的羽毛。

sentences.english: He said emperor penguins can spend months at a time in the ocean, coming ashore only to molt or rest, but did not know what might have caused this particular one to become disoriented.
sentences.chinese: 他说帝企鹅可以一次性在海里带上数月，上岸只是为了脱毛换羽和休息。 但不知道是什么造成了这只特别的企鹅变得分不清楚方向。

name: nocturnal
trans: adj. 夜的；夜曲的；夜间发生的

sentences.english: Hamsters are nocturnal creatures.
sentences.chinese: 仓鼠是夜行动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夜的；夜曲的；夜间发生的
detailed_translations.english: an animal that is nocturnal is active at night

name: paralyze
trans: vt. 使麻痹；使瘫痪

sentences.english: You can bet that would truly paralyze the flow of credit: Does anyone believe Washington can manage banks?
sentences.chinese: 你可以打赌，这会使流动的信贷真正限于瘫痪：真有人相信华盛顿可以经营银行吗？

sentences.english: I think we would all agree that it is well worth it, yet many of us still choose to let this innate fear paralyze us and settle into comfortable, secure positions despite being unhappy in them.
sentences.chinese: 我想每个人都认同这些东西是值得的，但是我们中许多人尽管对目前处境不甚满意，仍然选择麻痹于内在的恐惧，停滞于安逸，保险的职位。

name: sense
trans: n. 感觉，功能；观念；道理；理智 vt. 感觉到；检测 n. (Sense) （美）森斯（人名）

sentences.english: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing (= very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound ) .
sentences.chinese: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。

sentences.english: Employees need the sense of being appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

sentences.english: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，他完全失去了方向感。

sentences.english: This is true in a general sense.
sentences.chinese: 从一般意义上来讲，这是对的。

sentences.english: Perhaps he sensed your distrust.
sentences.chinese: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感官；感觉；理解力；判断力；意义
detailed_translations.english: one of the five natural powers of sight, hearing, feeling, taste, and smell, that give us information about the things around us
if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

name: venom
trans: n. 毒液；恶意 vt. 使有毒；放毒

sentences.english: There was real venom in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音非常凶狠。

sentences.english: a look of pure venom
sentences.chinese: 恶毒的表情

detailed_translations.english: great anger or hatred

name: arrange
trans: vt. 安排；排列；整理 vi. 安排；排列；协商

sentences.english: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请联络当地分部安排预约。

sentences.english: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
sentences.chinese: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

sentences.english: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
sentences.chinese: 马修两点钟依约而至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 准备； 整理
detailed_translations.english: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

name: challenge
trans: n. 挑战；怀疑 vt. 向…挑战；对…质疑

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

name: decision
trans: n. 决定，决心；决议

sentences.english: Do you ever wonder if you made the right decision?
sentences.chinese: 你怀疑过自己所作的决定是否正确吗？

sentences.english: The judges’ decision is final (= it will not be changed ).
sentences.chinese: 法官的裁决是最终判决。

sentences.english: the ability to act with speed and decision
sentences.chinese: 处事迅速果断的能力

detailed_translations.english: a choice or judgment that you make after a period of discussion or thought

name: gasp
trans: vi. 喘气；喘息；渴望 vt. 气喘吁吁地说；喘着气说话 n. 喘气

sentences.english: ‘My leg!’ he gasped. ‘I think it’s broken!’
sentences.chinese: “我的腿！”他倒抽一口气喊道，“我觉得腿断了！”

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain
when you take in a breath suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain

name: judge
trans: n. 法官；裁判员；鉴定人 v. 判断；猜测（大小、数量等）；裁判；评价；审判，判决 n. (Judge) （美、爱、英）贾奇（人名）

sentences.english: You should never judge a person by their looks.
sentences.chinese: 决不要以貌取人。

sentences.english: Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
sentences.chinese: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。

sentences.english: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
sentences.chinese: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。

sentences.english: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
sentences.chinese: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物

sentences.english: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。

sentences.english: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
sentences.chinese: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。

sentences.english: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
sentences.chinese: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。

sentences.english: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
sentences.chinese: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。

sentences.english: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为，从他所做的这一切客观地来评价，是不诚实的。

sentences.english: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.english: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
sentences.chinese: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

detailed_translations.english: to form or give an opinion about someone or something after thinking carefully about all the information you know about them
the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

name: attic
trans: n. 阁楼；顶楼；鼓室上的隐窝

sentences.english: a small attic room
sentences.chinese: 一间小阁楼

detailed_translations.chinese: 阁楼；顶楼；鼓室上的隐窝
detailed_translations.english: a space or room just below the roof of a house, often used for storing things

name: bandanna
trans: n. 扎染印花大手帕（等于bandana）

sentences.english: These days, her bandanna is usually red.
sentences.chinese: 这些天，她的印花大手帕通常是红色的。

sentences.english: The next morning, he bundled up some food in a red bandanna handkerchief, told his parents good-by, and set off into the world .
sentences.chinese: 次日早晨，他用一块红色的印花大手帕包了一些点心，告别了双亲，出发去闯天下。

name: clutch
trans: v. 紧握；（因害怕或痛苦）突然抓住；突然感到恐惧 n. 离合器（踏板）；一群；控制；紧握；一窝蛋；女式无带手提包 adj. 紧要关头的

sentences.english: Tony fell into the clutches of an attractive American who introduced him to drugs.
sentences.chinese: 托尼落入一个有魅力的美国人的掌控，那人给他介绍毒品。

sentences.english: I staggered and had to clutch at a chair for support.
sentences.chinese: 我踉跄了几步，不得不抓住一把椅子扶稳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离合器；控制；手；紧急关头
detailed_translations.english: the  pedal  that you press with your foot when driving a vehicle in order to change  gear  , or the part of the vehicle that this controls
If you clutch at something or clutch something, you hold it tightly, usually because you are afraid or anxious

detailed_translations.chinese: 没有手提带或背带的；紧要关头的

name: diary
trans: n. 日志，日记；日记簿

sentences.english: Inge kept a diary (= wrote in a diary ) during the war years.
sentences.chinese: 英奇在战争年代里一直写日记。

detailed_translations.english: a book in which you write down the things that happen to you each day

name: proof
trans: n. 证明；证据；校样；考验；验证；试验 adj. 防…的；不能透入的；证明用的；耐…的 vt. 试验；校对；使不被穿透

sentences.english: Their defences are proof against most weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们的防卫工事可以抵挡大多数武器的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: facts, information, documents etc that prove something is true

name: prowl
trans: v. 潜行；徘徊；搜寻 n. 徘徊，潜行；悄悄踱步；（动物）出动捕猎；四处搜寻（干某事的机会）

sentences.english: gangs of teenagers prowling the streets
sentences.chinese: 在大街上鬼鬼祟祟四处游荡的少年团伙

detailed_translations.english: if an animal prowls, it moves around an area quietly, especially because it is hunting another animal
if someone is on the prowl, they are moving around different places, looking for an opportunity to do something

name: argument
trans: n. 论证；论据；争吵；内容提要

sentences.english: She had a big argument with her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她和丈夫大吵了一架。

sentences.english: We need to provide a convincing argument as to why the system should be changed.
sentences.chinese: 我们得提出有说服力的论据，证明为何要改变体制。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two or more people disagree, often angrily

name: concentrate
trans: vi. 集中；浓缩；全神贯注；聚集 vt. 集中；浓缩 n. 浓缩，精选；浓缩液

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: hesitate
trans: vi. 踌躇，犹豫；不愿 vt. 踌躇，犹豫；有疑虑，不愿意

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

name: nervous
trans: adj. 神经的；紧张不安的；强健有力的

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

name: qualify
trans: vt. 限定，修饰；使具有资格；证明…合格 vi. 取得资格，有资格

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

name: regret
trans: vt. 后悔；对……感到遗憾；礼貌或正式地表示惋惜或抱歉；对（损失或缺乏）感到痛惜 vi. 遗憾 n. 遗憾，歉意

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

name: composer
trans: n. 作曲家；作家，著作者；设计者

sentences.english: ...music by Strauss, Mozart, Beethoven, and other great composers.
sentences.chinese: …施特劳斯、莫扎特、贝多芬及其他伟大作曲家创作的音乐。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes music

name: digital
trans: adj. 数字的；手指的 n. 数字；键

sentences.english: digital TV
sentences.chinese: 数字电视

sentences.english: a digital signal
sentences.chinese: 数字信号

sentences.english: a digital camera
sentences.chinese: 数码照相机

sentences.english: digital recording
sentences.chinese: 数字录音

detailed_translations.english: using a system in which information is recorded or sent out electronically in the form of numbers, usually ones and zeros

name: lever
trans: n. 杠杆；控制杆 vt. 用杠杆撬动；把…作为杠杆 vi. 用杠杆撬 n. (Lever)人名；(法)勒韦；(英)利弗；(德)莱韦尔

sentences.english: Pull this lever to open the gate.
sentences.chinese: 拉此横杆开启大门。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of metal that you use to lift something heavy by putting one end under the object and pushing the other end down
to move something with a lever

name: pedal
trans: n. （车辆，乐器的）踏板 v. 骑（自行车）；踩踏板 adj. 脚的；脚踏的

sentences.english: She was pedalling furiously (= very fast ) .
sentences.chinese: 她飞快地踩着踏板。

detailed_translations.english: to ride a bicycle
one of the two parts of a bicycle that you push round with your feet to make the bicycle go forward
of or relating to the foot or feet

name: pluck
trans: v. 采摘；扯；拔掉（死禽的毛）；弹拨（乐器的弦）；解救；抢夺；拔（眉毛）以使整洁；鼓起勇气；（冰川冰）拔削 n. 胆识，勇气；（供食用的）内脏；快而猛的拉

sentences.english: It takes a lot of pluck to stand up to a bully.
sentences.chinese: 不向恃强凌弱者屈服需要很大勇气。

detailed_translations.english: courage and determination
to pull something quickly in order to remove it

name: vibrate
trans: vi. 振动；颤动；摇摆；踌躇 vt. 使振动；使颤动

sentences.english: The floor was vibrating to the beat of the music.
sentences.chinese: 地板随着音乐的节奏在颤动。

sentences.english: As air passes over our vocal cords, it makes them vibrate.
sentences.chinese: 气流通过我们的声带，使之产生振动。

detailed_translations.english: if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements
if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements

name: expression
trans: n. 表现，表示，表达；表情，脸色，态度，腔调，声调；式，符号；词句，语句，措辞，说法

sentences.english: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression (= the right to say what you think without being punished ).
sentences.chinese: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词语； 表达， 表情
detailed_translations.english: something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel

name: freak
trans: n. 怪人，怪事；畸形人；反复无常 adj. 奇异的，反常的

sentences.english: These glasses make me look like a freak.
sentences.chinese: 我戴这副眼镜看上去像个怪人。

sentences.english: Women who studied engineering used to be considered freaks.
sentences.chinese: 学工程的女性过去常被视为怪物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怪人，怪事；畸形人；反复无常
detailed_translations.english: someone who is considered to be very strange because of the way they look, behave, or think
unexpected and very unusual

name: ghost
trans: n. 鬼，幽灵 vt. 作祟于；替…捉刀；为人代笔 vi. 替人代笔

sentences.english: They say the young girl’s ghost still haunts (= often appears in ) the house.
sentences.chinese: 他们说那个少女的鬼魂依旧在那房子里出没。

sentences.english: He looked as if he’d seen a ghost (= he looked very frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 他看上去像见到了鬼似的。

detailed_translations.english: the spirit of a dead person that some people think they can feel or see in a place

detailed_translations.chinese: 作祟于；替…捉刀；为人代笔
detailed_translations.english: to write something as a  ghost writer

name: Halloween
trans: n. 万圣节前夕（指十月三十一日夜晚）

sentences.english: What should I be for Halloween?
sentences.chinese: 万圣节我该打扮成什么模样？

sentences.english: How should I prepare for Halloween night?
sentences.chinese: 在万圣节之夜我该如何准备？

sentences.english: It might be due to the Halloween weekend, but the above reminds me of the below image.
sentences.chinese: 可能是因为周末是万圣节的关系，上面的图片让我联想到了下面的画面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 万圣节前夕（指十月三十一日夜晚）
detailed_translations.english: the night of October 31st, which is now celebrated by children, who dress in costumes and go from house to house asking for sweets, especially in the US and Canada. In the past, people believed the souls of dead people appeared on Halloween.

name: haunted
trans: adj. 闹鬼的；反复出现的；受到困扰的 v. 常去；缠住；使担忧（haunt的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: a haunted house
sentences.chinese: 闹鬼的房子

detailed_translations.english: a haunted building is believed to be visited regularly by the soul of a dead person

name: terrified
trans: v. （使）害怕，惊恐；恐吓（terrify 的过去式及过去分词） adj. 非常害怕的，极度惊恐的

sentences.english: a terrified little girl
sentences.chinese: 一个惊恐万分的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: very frightened

name: algae
trans: n. [植] 藻类；[植] 海藻

sentences.english: ...an effort to control toxic algae in Green Lake.
sentences.chinese: …控制绿湖里有毒水藻的努力。

detailed_translations.english: a very simple plant without stems or leaves that grows in or near water

name: arthropod
trans: n. 节肢动物 adj. 节肢动物的

sentences.english: The Japanese Spider Crab is the biggest arthropod on Earth--their legs are believed to grow up to 12 feet long.
sentences.chinese: 日本的蟹型蜘蛛是地球上最大的节肢动物，它们的腿被认为能够长到12英尺长。

sentences.english: We were hoping that was just a tiny trash can but, no, it's a coconut crab, which is the biggest arthropod that lives on land.
sentences.chinese: 我们本以为这是一个小小的垃圾桶，但是不，这是只椰子蟹，该物种是陆地上最大的节肢动物。

sentences.english: “Charlotte’s Web.” The story of the spider who saves her friend, the pig, is the kindest representation of an arthropod in literary history.
sentences.chinese: 《夏洛特的网》讲述了一只蜘蛛拯救她的猪朋友的故事，蜘蛛夏洛特成为文学史上最善良的节肢动物的代表。

detailed_translations.english: any invertebrate of the phylum Arthropoda, having jointed limbs, a segmented body, and an exoskeleton made of chitin

name: erode
trans: vt. 腐蚀，侵蚀 vi. 侵蚀；受腐蚀

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

name: invertebrate
trans: adj. 无脊椎的；无骨气的 n. 无脊椎动物；无骨气的人

sentences.english: Concept artist Terryl Whitlatch wanted the colo claw fish to have an invertebrate look, so her early designs were based on an earwig.
sentences.chinese: 概念画家特丽尔·惠特拉奇希望科洛爪鱼拥有无脊椎动物的外表，所以她的早期设计是以蠼螋为基础的。

sentences.english: There was a hierarchical system in neurobiology, and working in invertebrate animals was not looked upon favorably, except in a very special case: the squid giant axon.
sentences.chinese: 神经生物学中有一个等级系统，无脊椎动物的研究不被看好，除了非常特殊的例子：枪乌贼巨大的轴突。

sentences.english: Smithers, don't you think it's ironic that your irregular night-time activities are in inverse proportion to your reputation as an expert in the area of invertebrate research?
sentences.chinese: 斯密德斯，难道你不认为自己无规律的夜生活与你作为无脊椎动物研究领域的专家的声望成反比是具有讽刺意味的吗？

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that does not have a  backbone

name: larvae
trans: n. 幼虫，幼体（larva 的复数）

sentences.english: In fact, the animal uses its middle finger to find and harvest insect larvae in trees.
sentences.chinese: 实际上， 这种动物用其中指搜索和俘获藏在树木里的昆虫幼虫。

sentences.english: FLATOW: ...thank you, in their beaks, and poke in to pull out these larvae out of a tree.
sentences.chinese: 傅拉托：对，...谢谢你，是用它们的"喙"(鸟嘴)，把树枝戳进洞里去，把幼虫从树洞里钓出来。

sentences.english: We know that freshwater eels reproduce in the ocean because larvae have been found drifting near the surface thousands of miles from any shore.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道淡水鳗鱼在海里繁殖，因为我们曾经在距所有海岸数千英里的海面发现过漂动的鳗鱼幼体。

name: hippocampus
trans: n. 海马结构；马头鱼尾怪兽（神话中的一个形象）

name: information
trans: n. 信息，资料；知识；情报

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

name: mnemonic
trans: adj. 记忆的；助记的；记忆术的

name: repeat
trans: v. 重复说（或写）；照着说；再说一次；重复做；重播（节目）；重修；（选举中违法）重复投票；再次成功；（钟表按要求）连打；在口中留下余味；转述 n. 重复的行动（或事件）；（电视或广播的）重播；重复；（同类货物的）再次运送；重复装饰图案；（音乐）反复部分；反复记号

sentences.english: Can you repeat your question?
sentences.chinese: 你能重复一遍你的问题吗？

sentences.english: Sorry - could you repeat that?
sentences.chinese: 对不起——你能再说一遍吗？

sentences.english: It is not, I repeat not, my fault.
sentences.chinese: 那不是我的错，我再说一遍，不是。

sentences.english: It was a terrible journey - I hope we don’t have a repeat performance (= have the same thing happen again ) on the way home.
sentences.chinese: 这一路上太糟糕了——我希望回程可不要再发生同样的事。

detailed_translations.english: to say or write something again
an event that is very like something that happened before

name: technology
trans: n. 技术；工艺；术语

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

name: chant
trans: n. 圣歌；赞美诗 vt. 唱；诵扬 vi. 唱歌；反复地唱歌 n. (Chant)人名；(英)钱特

sentences.english: ...a Gregorian chant.
sentences.chinese: …一首格列高利圣歌。

detailed_translations.english: a regularly repeated tune, often with many words sung on one note, especially used for religious prayers
to repeat a word or phrase again and again

name: culture
trans: n. 文化，文明；修养；栽培 vt. [细胞][微] 培养（等于cultivate）

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

name: festival
trans: n. 节日；庆祝，纪念活动；欢乐 adj. 节日的，喜庆的；快乐的

sentences.english: the Swansea Festival of Music and the Arts
sentences.chinese: 斯旺西音乐艺术节

sentences.english: Christmas is one of the main festivals in the Christian Calendar.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节是基督教历的重大节日之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔电影、戏剧、音乐等的〕节，节庆，会演；节日
detailed_translations.english: an occasion when there are performances of many films, plays, pieces of music etc, usually happening in the same place every year

name: gesture
trans: n. 姿态；手势 vi. 作手势；用动作示意 vt. 用动作表示

sentences.english: Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆举起双手，做出绝望的手势。

sentences.english: The Queen has now made a gesture towards public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 女王现在摆出了尊重民意的姿态。

detailed_translations.english: a movement of part of your body, especially your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel

name: rhythm
trans: n. 节奏；韵律

sentences.english: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。

sentences.english: complicated dance rhythms
sentences.chinese: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

sentences.english: the body’s natural rhythms
sentences.chinese: 人体的自然节律

detailed_translations.english: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

name: condense
trans: vi. 浓缩；凝结 vt. 使浓缩；使压缩

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

name: drought
trans: n. 干旱；缺乏 n. (Drought)人名；(英)德劳特

sentences.english: ...a country where drought and famines have killed up to two million people during the last eighteen years.
sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

name: evaporate
trans: vt. 使……蒸发；使……脱水；使……消失 vi. 蒸发，挥发；消失，失踪

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: insulated
trans: v. （使）隔热（或隔音、绝缘）；（使）免受不良影响；（使）陆地成岛屿（insulate 的过去式及过去分词） adj. 有隔热（或隔音、绝缘）保护的

name: vent
trans: n. （气体、液体的）进出口，通风口，排放口；（感情的）发泄；（小动物的）肛门；火山口；（上衣底部的）开衩；（烟囱的）烟道；炮口 v. 表达，发泄（强烈感情感情，尤指愤怒）；给……提供出口或排放口，排放；使空气进入（啤酒桶）；给上衣开衩 n. (Vent) （美、德）芬特（人名）

sentences.english: a blocked air vent
sentences.chinese: 堵塞的通风口

sentences.english: a volcanic vent
sentences.chinese: 火山口

detailed_translations.english: a hole or pipe through which gases, liquid etc can enter or escape from an enclosed space or container
to express feelings of anger, hatred etc, especially by doing something violent or harmful

name: curse
trans: n. 诅咒；咒骂 vt. 诅咒；咒骂 vi. 诅咒；咒骂

sentences.english: He believed that someone had put a curse on the house.
sentences.chinese: 他相信有人对这房子下了诅咒。

detailed_translations.english: a word or sentence used to ask God or a magical power to do something bad to someone or something

name: design
trans: n. 设计；构思；设计图样；装饰图案；打算 v. 设计，构思；计划；制造，意欲 n. (Design) （巴、印、俄）迪赛（人名）

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

detailed_translations.english: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
detailed_translations.english: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

name: festive
trans: adj. 节日的；喜庆的；欢乐的

sentences.english: The atmosphere was festive and jolly.
sentences.chinese: 气氛喜庆欢乐。

sentences.english: John was obviously in a festive mood .
sentences.chinese: 约翰显然喜气洋洋的。

detailed_translations.english: looking or feeling bright and cheerful in a way that seems suitable for celebrating something

name: immigrate
trans: vi. 移入 vt. 使移居入境

sentences.english: His father and mother immigrated when he was two.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母在他两岁时移民到这里。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a country in order to live there permanently

name: stingy
trans: adj. 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的

sentences.english: She’s too stingy to give money to charity.
sentences.chinese: 她很小气，不愿捐钱行善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的
detailed_translations.english: not generous, especially with money

name: athlete
trans: n. 运动员，体育家；身强力壮的人

sentences.english: a professional athlete

sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

sentences.chinese: 可是小人鱼没有这样做的必要，固为当珊瑚虫一看到这亮晶晶的药水——它在她的手里亮得像一颗闪耀的星星——的时候，它们就在她面前惶恐地缩回去了。

sentences.chinese: 难民营
