trans: n. 罚款，罚金；处罚

sentences.english: No littering. Penalty $500.
sentences.chinese: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。

sentences.english: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.english: If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty (= be killed as a punishment ) .
sentences.chinese: 一旦定罪，他可能会被判处死刑。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

name: teamwork
trans: n. 团队合作；协力

sentences.english: We want to encourage good teamwork and communication.
sentences.chinese: 我们要鼓励良好的团队合作和沟通。

detailed_translations.english: when a group of people work effectively together

name: advantage
trans: n. 优势；利益；有利条件 vi. 获利 vt. 有利于；使处于优势

sentences.english: Younger workers tend to be at an advantage (=  have an advantage  ) when applying for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 年轻点的工人申请工作时往往处于优势地位。

sentences.english: One of the many advantages of living in New York is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
sentences.chinese: 住在纽约的诸多好处之一是几乎任何时候都可以外出吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having this

name: dribble
trans: v. 流（口水），垂（涎）；滴下，细流；运球 n. 点滴，细流；口水；运球；蠢话，馊主意

sentences.english: He was trying to dribble the ball past his opponents.
sentences.chinese: 他想带球晃过对方球员。

detailed_translations.english: to move the ball along with you by short kicks,  bounce s  , or hits in a game of football,  basketball  etc
the act of moving the ball along with you by short kicks,  bounce s  or hits in a game of football,  basketball  etc

name: forfeit
trans: v. （因犯罪、失职、违约等）丧失（权利、名誉、生命等） n. 罚金；没收物；丧失的东西 adj. 因受罚而丧失的；被没收的；被剥夺的

sentences.english: The company’s property may even be forfeit.
sentences.chinese: 公司财产甚至可能被没收。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罚金；没收物；丧失的东西
detailed_translations.english: something that is taken away from you or something that you have to pay, because you have broken a rule or made a mistake

detailed_translations.chinese: 因受罚而丧失的；被没收的
detailed_translations.english: to be legally or officially taken away from you as a punishment

detailed_translations.chinese: （因犯罪、失职、违约等）丧失（权利、名誉、生命等）

name: meteor
trans: n. 流星；[气象] 大气现象

sentences.english: Astronomers track large meteors using radar.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家使用雷达跟踪大型流星。

sentences.english: a meteor shower
sentences.chinese: 流星雨

detailed_translations.chinese: 流星；[气象] 大气现象
detailed_translations.english: a piece of rock or metal that travels through space, and makes a bright line in the night sky when it falls down towards the Earth

name: shoot
trans: vt. 射击，射中；拍摄；发芽；使爆炸；给…注射 vi. 射击；发芽；拍电影 n. 射击；摄影；狩猎；急流

sentences.english: Police shot one suspect when he pulled a gun on them.
sentences.chinese: 警方在一名嫌疑人拔枪指着他们时击毙了他。

sentences.english: Smith killed his wife, and then shot himself.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯杀死妻子，然后开枪自杀。

sentences.english: A woman was shot dead in an attempted robbery.
sentences.chinese: 一名女子在一桩未遂抢劫案中中枪身亡。

sentences.english: The guards have orders to shoot intruders on sight (= shoot them as soon as they see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫兵们奉命一见到有人闯入就开枪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 射击，射中；拍摄；发芽；使爆炸；给…注射
detailed_translations.english: to deliberately kill or injure someone using a gun
an occasion when someone takes photographs or makes a film

name: annoy
trans: vt. 骚扰；惹恼；打搅 vi. 惹恼；令人讨厌；打搅 n. 烦恼（等于annoyance）

sentences.english: He is not doing this to annoy you.
sentences.chinese: 他做这件事并非是要惹你烦恼。

sentences.english: I am convinced that some people complain just to annoy me, for something to do, or they simply enjoy complaining.
sentences.chinese: 我以为身边的人抱怨是为了令我烦恼、是为了解决某些事、又或者他们就是喜欢抱怨。

name: appreciate
trans: vt. 欣赏；感激；领会；鉴别 vi. 增值；涨价

sentences.english: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，我真的很感激。

sentences.english: I appreciate your concern , but honestly, I’m fine.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你关心，不过说真的，我很好。

sentences.english: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能让我继续工作，我会非常感激。

sentences.english: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
sentences.chinese: 她的才干没有得到雇主的充分赏识。

sentences.english: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：我不是专家，但我欣赏优秀的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done

name: engrossed
trans: adj. 全神贯注的；专心致志的 v. 全神贯注（engross的过去分词）

sentences.english: Tony didn't notice because he was too engrossed in his work.
sentences.chinese: 托尼因过于全神贯注于工作而没有注意到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全神贯注的；专心致志的
detailed_translations.english: If you are engrossed in something, it holds your attention completely

name: relieved
trans: adj. 感到宽慰的，放心的，不再忧虑的 v. 减轻，解除，缓解；调剂，使有趣；接替，换岗；解围；方便（上厕所的委婉说法）（relieve 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: A relieved smile spread over his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸上绽开了宽慰的笑容。

name: volunteer
trans: n. 志愿者；志愿兵 adj. 志愿的 vi. 自愿 vt. 自愿

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: attracted
trans: 吸引 的兴趣 被吸引的

name: digest
trans: vt. 消化；吸收；融会贯通 vi. 消化 n. 文摘；摘要

sentences.english: Most babies can digest a wide range of food easily.
sentences.chinese: 大多数婴儿能轻易地消化很多种食物。

sentences.english: I struggled to digest the news.
sentences.chinese: 我费力地琢磨着那条新闻。

sentences.english: a monthly news digest
sentences.chinese: 每月新闻摘要

detailed_translations.english: to change food that you have just eaten into substances that your body can use
a short piece of writing that gives the most important facts from a book, report etc

name: host
trans: n. [计] 主机；主人；主持人；许多 vt. 主持；当主人招待 vi. 群集；做主人

sentences.english: Which country is going to host the next World Cup?
sentences.chinese: 哪个国家将主办下一届世界杯？

detailed_translations.english: to provide the place and everything that is needed for an organized event

name: nutrient
trans: n. 营养物；滋养物 adj. 营养的；滋养的

sentences.english: The plant absorbs nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸取养分。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical or food that provides what is needed for plants or animals to live and grow

name: plant
trans: n. 工厂，车间；植物；设备；庄稼 vt. 种植；培养；栽培；安置 vi. 种植 n. (Plant)人名；(英、西、意)普兰特；(法)普朗

sentences.english: Don’t forget to water the plants.
sentences.chinese: 别忘记给植物浇水。

sentences.english: a huge chemical plant
sentences.chinese: 一座大型化工厂

sentences.english: Residents have helped us plant trees.
sentences.chinese: 居民们帮助我们种了树。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow

name: gymnast
trans: n. 体操运动员

sentences.english: Nora was an excellent gymnast in this country.
sentences.chinese: 诺拉是这个国家卓越的体操运动员。

sentences.english: I was 26 by then -- which is ancient for a male gymnast.
sentences.chinese: 我那时26岁，作为一名男子体操运动员已经太老了。

sentences.english: Ah, the perspective of the proud gymnast.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，自以为是的体操运动员的观点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is good at gymnastics and competes against other people in gymnastics competitions

name: marathon
trans: n. 马拉松赛跑；耐力的考验 adj. 马拉松式的；有耐力的 vi. 参加马拉松赛跑

sentences.english: the Boston Marathon
sentences.chinese: 波士顿马拉松赛

sentences.english: Garcia ran the marathon in just under three hours.
sentences.chinese: 加西亚用了不到三小时就跑完了马拉松。

detailed_translations.chinese: 马拉松赛跑；耐力的考验
detailed_translations.english: a long race of about 26 miles or 42 kilometres
a marathon event continues for a long time and needs a lot of energy, patience, or determination

name: pentathlon
trans: n. 五项运动；五项全能运动

sentences.english: Your life is a pentathlon of five purposes, which you must keep in balance.
sentences.chinese: 你的生命也是有五个目的的五项全能赛，你必须保持均衡。

sentences.english: By the late 8th century BC, events included running, wrestling, boxing, pancratium (a mixture of boxing and wrestling), chariot racing, a footrace with heavy armor, and the pentathlon.
sentences.chinese: 在公元前8世纪末，比赛项目包括赛跑、摔跤、拳击、角斗(摔跤和拳击并用)、赛车、负重跑和五项全能运动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 五项运动；五项全能运动
detailed_translations.english: a sports event involving five different sports

name: stroke
trans: n. （游泳或划船的）划；中风；（打、击等的）一下；冲程；（成功的）举动；尝试；轻抚 vt. （用笔等）画；轻抚；轻挪；敲击；划尾桨；划掉；（打字时）击打键盘 vi. 击球；作尾桨手，指挥划桨；（打字时）击打键盘

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

name: champion
trans: n. 冠军；拥护者；战士 vt. 支持；拥护 adj. 优胜的；第一流的 n. (Champion)人名；(英)钱皮恩；(法)尚皮翁

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

name: competitor
trans: n. 竞争者，对手

sentences.english: Last year they sold twice as many computers as their competitors.
sentences.chinese: 去年他们的计算机销量是竞争对手的两倍。

detailed_translations.english: a person, team, company etc that is competing with another

name: heat
trans: n. 高温；压力；热度；热烈 vt. 使激动；把…加热

sentences.english: Ice needs heat to melt.
sentences.chinese: 冰需要热才能融化。

sentences.english: Insulating the attic is a good way to reduce heat loss.
sentences.chinese: 为阁楼安装隔热层是减少热量流失的好方法。

sentences.english: The heat was making them tired.
sentences.chinese: 炎热的天气令他们疲倦。

sentences.english: Heat the milk until it boils.
sentences.chinese: 把牛奶煮开。

detailed_translations.english: warmth or the quality of being hot
to make something become warm or hot

name: Polynesian
trans: adj. 波利尼西亚的；波利尼西亚人的 n. 波利尼西亚人

sentences.english: Allegiance to chiefs was a fundamental of Polynesian culture.
sentences.chinese: 效忠首领是波利尼西亚人最基本的文化。

sentences.english: It is possible that Polynesian rats, arriving with human settlers, may have eaten enough seeds to help to decimate the trees.
sentences.chinese: 有可能是与人类共同达到该岛的波利尼西亚鼠类，吃掉了大量的种子促成了棕榈树的大批死亡。

sentences.english: Polynesian society blossomed in this unlikely locale after hardy souls somehow navigated a fleet of wooden outrigger canoes to this tiny speck in the vastness of the Pacific Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 在一群勇敢的人们驾驶着一队独木舟来到广阔的太平洋上的这个小岛上，一个波利尼西亚社会开始在这个不可思议的位置繁荣了起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 波利尼西亚人, 波利尼西亚语
detailed_translations.english: a member of the people that inhabit Polynesia, generally of Caucasoid features with light skin and wavy hair

name: surf
trans: n. 海浪，拍岸浪 vt. 在…冲浪 vi. 作冲浪运动 n. (Surf)人名；(英)瑟夫

sentences.english: I'm going to buy a surfboard and learn to surf.
sentences.chinese: 我要去买个冲浪板来学冲浪。

detailed_translations.english: to ride on waves while standing on a special board

name: disease
trans: n. 病，[医] 疾病；弊病 vt. 传染；使…有病

sentences.english: His father died of heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲死于心脏病。

sentences.english: She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 她在国外度假时染上了这种疾病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病， 疾病； 不健全， 弊端
detailed_translations.english: an illness which affects a person, animal, or plant

name: limp
trans: adj. 柔软的，无力的；软弱的 vi. 跛行，一拐一拐地走；缓慢费力地前进 n. 跛行 n. (Limp)人名；(英)林普

sentences.english: a limp handshake
sentences.chinese: 无力的握手

sentences.english: His body suddenly went limp.
sentences.chinese: 他突然身子一软。

detailed_translations.english: not firm or strong

detailed_translations.chinese: 跛行，一拐一拐地走；缓慢费力地前进
detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured
the way someone walks when they are limping

name: prosthetic
trans: adj. 假体的；非朊基的

name: research
trans: n. 研究；调查 vi. 研究；调查 vt. 研究；调查 [ 过去式 researched 过去分词 researched 现在分词 researching ]

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: device
trans: n. 装置；策略；图案；设备；终端

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: inexperienced
trans: adj. 无经验的；不熟练的

sentences.english: inexperienced pilots
sentences.chinese: 经验不足的飞行员

detailed_translations.english: not having had much experience

name: initiate
trans: vt. 开始，创始；发起；使初步了解 n. 开始；新加入者，接受初步知识者 adj. 新加入的；接受初步知识的

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

name: manipulation
trans: n. 操纵；操作；处理；篡改

sentences.english: They make a lot of money by clever manipulation of the Stock Market.
sentences.chinese: 他们巧妙地操纵股票市场而大赚其钱。

name: sequence
trans: n. [数][计] 序列；顺序；续发事件 vt. 按顺序排好

sentences.english: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence.
sentences.chinese: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

detailed_translations.english: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

name: unstable
trans: adj. 不稳定的；动荡的；易变的

sentences.english: The political situation is still very unstable.
sentences.chinese: 政局依然非常动荡。

sentences.english: an unstable relationship
sentences.chinese: 不稳定的关系

detailed_translations.english: likely to change sud­denly and become worse

name: benefit
trans: n. 利益，好处；救济金 vt. 有益于，对…有益 vi. 受益，得益

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: 利益，恩惠；救济金，保险金，津贴
detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

name: compost
trans: n. 堆肥；混合物 vt. 堆肥；施堆肥

sentences.english: ...a small compost heap.
sentences.chinese: …一小堆肥堆。

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of decayed plants, leaves etc used to improve the quality of soil

name: recycle
trans: v. 回收利用；使再循环；重新使用 n. 回收利用，循环使用

sentences.english: The fashion world just keeps recycling old ideas.
sentences.chinese: 时装界就是不停地翻新旧观念。

detailed_translations.english: to use something such as an idea, writing etc again instead of developing something new

name: reduce
trans: vt. 减少；降低；使处于；把…分解 vi. 减少；缩小；归纳为

sentences.english: The governor announced a new plan to reduce crime.
sentences.chinese: 州长宣布了一项降低犯罪率的新计划。

sentences.english: The helmet law should reduce injuries in motorcycle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 头盔法的实施应该能减少摩托车事故的受伤率。

sentences.english: Small businesses will need to reduce costs in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 小企业要想生存必须削减成本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price

name: resource
trans: n. 资源，财力；办法；智谋 vi. 向...提供资金

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: reuse
trans: v. 再次使用；重复使用 n. 再次使用；重复使用

sentences.english: Copper, brass, and aluminium are separated and remelted for reuse.
sentences.chinese: 铜、黄铜和铝被分门别类重新熔化以供再利用。

detailed_translations.english: Reuse is also a noun
to use something again

name: electron
trans: n. 电子

sentences.english: Most things are balanced - with equal numbers of electrons and protons.
sentences.chinese: 大部分物体都是电荷平衡的——含等量的电子和质子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge that moves around the nucleus of an atom

name: invisible
trans: adj. 无形的，看不见的；无形的；不显眼的，暗藏的

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

name: lens
trans: n. 透镜，镜头；眼睛中的水晶体；晶状体；隐形眼镜；汽车的灯玻璃 vt. 给……摄影

sentences.english: a standard 50mm lens
sentences.chinese: 50毫米标准镜头

detailed_translations.chinese: 透镜， 镜片； 镜头
detailed_translations.english: the part of a camera through which the light travels before it reaches the film

name: magnify
trans: vt. 放大；赞美；夸大 vi. 放大；有放大能力

sentences.english: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
sentences.chinese: 在谢菲尔德体育馆，演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。

sentences.english: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
sentences.chinese: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

sentences.english: The report tends to magnify the risks involved
sentences.chinese: 这份报告有夸大所涉风险的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

name: microscope
trans: n. 显微镜

sentences.english: The slightest movement will defocus the microscope.
sentences.chinese: 最轻微的运动都会使显微镜散焦。

sentences.english: The microscope magnified the object two hundred times.
sentences.chinese: 这架显微镜把实物放大了200倍。

sentences.english: The microscope capacitates small objects to be observed.
sentences.chinese: 显微镜可以观察到微小的物体。

detailed_translations.english: a scientific instrument that makes extremely small things look larger

name: equality
trans: n. 平等；相等；[数] 等式

sentences.english: ...equality of the sexes.
sentences.chinese: …性别平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等同； 平等； 相等
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people have the same rights, advantages etc

name: justice
trans: n. 司法，法律制裁；正义；法官，审判员 n. (Justice)人名；(英)贾斯蒂斯，贾斯蒂丝(女名)

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

name: South
trans: n. 南；（罗盘的）南方 adj. 位于南方的；（风）来自南方的；南部居民的 adv. 向南，朝南 v. 朝南移动；（天体）穿过子午线 n. (South) （美）苏（人名）

name: content
trans: n. 内容，目录；满足；容量 adj. 满意的 vt. 使满足 n. (Content)人名；(法)孔唐

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

name: despair
trans: n. 绝望；令人绝望的人或事 vi. 绝望，丧失信心

sentences.english: To the despair of the workers, the company announced the closure of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 令工人们感到绝望的是，公司宣布关闭工厂了。

sentences.english: Despite his illness, Ron never despaired.
sentences.chinese: 尽管疾病缠身，罗恩却从不绝望。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you have no hope at all
to feel that there is no hope at all

name: haven
trans: n. 保护区，避难所；港口 v. 为……提供避难所 n. (Haven) （美）黑文（人名）

sentences.english: ...Lake Baringo, a freshwater haven for a mixed variety of birds.
sentences.chinese: …百瑞高湖，一个适合各种鸟类的淡水栖息地。

detailed_translations.english: a place where people or animals can live peacefully or go to in order to be safe

detailed_translations.chinese: 为……提供避难处；安置……于港中

name: mood
trans: n. 情绪，语气；心境；气氛 n. (Mood)人名；(英)穆德；(瑞典)莫德

sentences.english: You’re in a good mood this morning!
sentences.chinese: 你今天早晨心情不错啊！

sentences.english: the general mood of depression in the office
sentences.chinese: 办公室里普遍的沮丧情绪

detailed_translations.english: the way you feel at a particular time

name: sketch
trans: n. 素描；略图；梗概 vt. 画素描或速写 vi. 画素描或速写 n. (Sketch)人名；(英)斯凯奇

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail
a short humorous scene on a television programme, in a theatre etc, that is part of a larger show

name: style
trans: n. 风格；时尚；类型；字体 vt. 设计；称呼；使合潮流 vi. 设计式样；用刻刀作装饰画 n. (Style)人名；(英)斯泰尔

sentences.english: an attempt to use Japanese management style in a European business
sentences.chinese: 将日本的管理方式用于欧洲企业的尝试

detailed_translations.english: a particular way of doing, designing, or producing something, especially one that is typical of a particular place, period of time, or group of people
to design clothing, furniture, or the shape of someone’s hair in a particular way

name: astronomer
trans: n. 天文学家

sentences.english: My ideal is to be an astronomer.
sentences.chinese: 我的理想是当一个天文学家。

sentences.english: If people know you’re an astronomer, they will soon be asking you all about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人知道你是个天文学家，他们会很快向你询问关于这件事的一切。

sentences.english: Any astronomer, at any university, in any country can write a proposal for what they want to do with the telescope.
sentences.chinese: 任何国家、任何大学的天文学家都可以递交申请，告诉我们他们想要使用这台望远镜做什么。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies the stars and  planet s

name: image
trans: n. 影像；想象；肖像；偶像 vt. 想象；反映；象征；作…的像 n. (Image)人名；(法)伊马热

sentences.english: attempts to improve the image of the police
sentences.chinese: 提升警察形象的努力

sentences.english: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
sentences.chinese: 他脑海中对父母的印象极其清晰。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public

name: observatory
trans: n. 天文台；气象台；瞭望台

sentences.english: An observatory on the back side of the Moon would be a giant leap for astronomy, but there is a for more important reason to return.
sentences.chinese: 即使仅仅在月球的背面设置一个天文台，也将为天文学带来革命性的突破，何况月球的价值远远不止这些。

sentences.english: With a full-power observatory in place, that explanation, as well as a better explanation of high-energy astrophysical phenomena throughout the universe, may be available in the years to come.
sentences.chinese: 一个满负荷运作的观测站的到位，对那些热点的解释，以及对遍及宇宙的高能天文学现象的更好的解释，将会在今年内成为可能。

name: telescope
trans: n. 望远镜 v. 叠套缩短；精简，压缩；（车）相撞而嵌进

sentences.english: The captain was rectifying his telescope.
sentences.chinese: 船长正在调他的望远镜。

sentences.english: The telescope reveals many distant stars to our sight.
sentences.chinese: 望远镜把许多遥远的星球显现在我们的眼前。

sentences.english: With the aid of a telescope a ship could be made out on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 借助望远镜可以看出在地平线上有一只船。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer

name: trolley
trans: n. 手推车；（送食品饮料的）小车，台车；有轨电车；无轨电车；电车触轮（与架空电线接触以驱动电车）；有轨缆车，架空缆车；（医院用的）担架车 v. 乘电车；用手推车运 【名】 （Trolley）（英）特罗利（人名）

sentences.english: a supermarket trolley
sentences.chinese: 超市购物手推车

detailed_translations.chinese: 手推车；（美）有轨电车（等于trolley car）；（英）无轨电车（等于trolleybus）；空中吊运车
detailed_translations.english: a large basket on wheels that you use for carrying bags, shopping etc

name: basilica
trans: n. （古罗马）长方形会堂；长方形基督教堂；长方形廊柱大厅 n. (Basilica)人名；(西)巴西利卡

name: condominium
trans: n. 共同统治；财产共有权；独立产权的公寓

detailed_translations.chinese: 共同统治；财产共有权；独立产权的公寓
detailed_translations.english: one apartment in a building with several apartments, each of which is owned by the people living in it

name: piazza
trans: n. 露天市场，广场；走廊 n. (Piazza)人名；(法、西、意)皮亚扎

name: barrier
trans: n. 障碍物，屏障；界线 vt. 把…关入栅栏 n. (Barrier)人名；(法)巴里耶

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: hazard
trans: n. 危险，风险；冒险的事；机会；双骰子游戏；（高尔夫球的）球场障碍；（庭院网球用语）可得分区域；（台球）落入袋中 v. 大胆猜测；冒……的危险，使遭受危险；冒昧提出 n. (Hazard) 哈泽德（人名）

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

name: levee
trans: n. 堤坝（码头）；（旧时君主或显贵的）早晨接见 vt. 为…筑堤 n. (Levee)人名；(利比)莱维

sentences.english: Water poured over a levee and flooded about 75 percent of Montegut.
sentences.chinese: 水漫过了河堤并淹没了蒙特古特75%的地区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 堤坝（码头）；（旧时君主或显贵的）早晨接见
detailed_translations.english: A levee is a raised bank alongside a river

name: overflow
trans: v. （尤指液体）溢出；（容器）满得溢出；挤满人了；淹没（某一表面或地区）；过度延伸 n. 泛滥；挤不下或多余的人（或物）；溢流管；数据过载

sentences.english: The drains flooded and water overflowed down the main street.
sentences.chinese: 下水道被淹，水溢到了大街上。

sentences.english: The river had overflowed its banks.
sentences.chinese: 河水漫堤了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 满得外溢，外流，泛滥；充满，洋溢
detailed_translations.english: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges

detailed_translations.chinese: 淹没， 从…中溢出， 多得无法容纳
detailed_translations.english: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges

detailed_translations.chinese: 容纳不下的物； 溢出， 满出； 溢流口， 溢流管
detailed_translations.english: the amount of something or the number of people that cannot be contained in a place because it is already full

name: severe
trans: adj. 严峻的；严厉的；剧烈的；苛刻的

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: stilt
trans: n. 高跷；支柱，支撑物 vt. 使踏上高跷

sentences.english: When holidays came, there were Yangko and stilt shows with people eager to participate.
sentences.chinese: 过节时会有扭秧歌、踩高跷表演，人们也都乐意参加。

sentences.english: The most noteworthy features of mangrove forests, apart from their unique habitat, are: the relative paucity of the species comprising them; the arch-formed stilt roots of the Rhizophora spp.;
sentences.chinese: 除了其独特的生境以外， 红树林最令人注意的特征是构成红树林的品种比较单一； Rhizophora 品种的拱形高跷根系；其它属的悬空根系团或呼吸根，如 Avicennia 和 Sonneratia。

detailed_translations.english: one of two poles which you can stand on and walk high above the ground

name: beard
trans: n. （下巴上的）胡须；颌毛；（非正式）男同性恋者的名义女伴；替身 v. 对抗或反对（有权势者）；抓……的胡须；提供胡须 n. (Beard) （美、英、加、法）比尔德（人名）

sentences.english: He's decided to grow a beard.
sentences.chinese: 他已经决定蓄胡须。

detailed_translations.english: hair that grows around a man’s chin and cheeks

name: elected
trans: v. 选举，推选；决定做……，选择做……（elect 的过去式和过去分词）

name: fashion
trans: n. 时尚；时装；样式；方式；时髦人物 vt. 使用；改变；做成…的形状

sentences.english: Their music will never go out of fashion (= stop being fashionable ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.english: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion.
sentences.chinese: 请大家有秩序地离开大楼。

sentences.english: Perhaps they could sit down and discuss things in a civilised fashion.
sentences.chinese: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。

sentences.english: She will be working out her problems in her own fashion (= in the way that she usually does this ) .
sentences.chinese: 她会以自己的方式来解决她的问题。

detailed_translations.english: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time

name: letter
trans: n. 信；字母，文字；证书；文学，学问；字面意义 vt. 写字母于 vi. 写印刷体字母 n. (Letter) （美、英、巴西）莱特（人名）

sentences.english: I got a letter from Melanie today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我收到梅拉妮的一封信。

sentences.english: There are 26 letters in the English alphabet.
sentences.chinese: 英语字母表有26个字母。

detailed_translations.english: a written or printed message that is usually put in an envelope and sent by mail

name: president
trans: n. 总统；董事长；校长；主席

sentences.english: President Bush
sentences.chinese: 布什总统

sentences.english: the president of General Motors
sentences.chinese: 通用汽车公司总裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 总统；（某组织的）最高权力人
detailed_translations.english: the official leader of a country that does not have a king or queen

name: suggestion
trans: n. 建议；示意；微量，细微的迹象

sentences.english: Any suggestions would be welcome.
sentences.chinese: 任何建议都欢迎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 建议， 意见； 细微的迹象； 暗示
detailed_translations.english: an idea, plan, or possibility that someone mentions, or the act of mentioning it

name: cello
trans: n. 大提琴 n. (Cello)人名；(意)切洛；(法)塞洛

sentences.english: All this from playing the violin and the cello.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都来自于小提琴和大提琴的演奏。

sentences.english: Classical instruments like the violin or the cello are boring, you say, and definitely not cool.
sentences.chinese: 你觉得小提琴或大提琴这样的传统乐器非常枯燥，而且一点也不酷。

sentences.english: Many years ago, a young man learning cello went to Casals, the greatest cellist in the 20th century, for advice: how can I become an excellent cellist?
sentences.chinese: 很多年前，有一位学大提琴的年轻人去向20世纪最伟大的大提琴家卡萨尔斯讨教：我怎样才能成为一名优秀的大提琴家？

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a large  violin  that you hold between your knees and play by pulling a  bow (= special stick )  across the strings

name: classical
trans: adj. 古典的；经典的；传统的；第一流的 n. 古典音乐

sentences.english: the classical theory of relativity
sentences.chinese: 经典相对论

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a traditional style or set of ideas

name: ensemble
trans: n. 全体；总效果；全套服装；全套家具；合奏组 adv. 同时

sentences.english: an attractive ensemble
sentences.chinese: 一套漂亮的服装

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体；总效果；全套服装；全套家具；合奏组
detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes that are worn together

name: orchestra
trans: n. 管弦乐队；乐队演奏处

sentences.english: He directed an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥一个管弦乐队。

sentences.english: She conducted an orchestra of forty instruments.
sentences.chinese: 她在一个拥有40种乐器的管弦乐队里当指挥。

name: anesthesia
trans: n. 麻醉；麻木（等于anaesthesia）

sentences.english: Studies in rodents and monkeys have repeatedly shown that exposure to anesthesia at a very young age kills brain cells.
sentences.chinese: 对于啮齿动物和猴子的研究也多次说明在年龄非常小的时候接受麻醉会杀死脑细胞。

sentences.english: For example, a certain kind of muscle relaxant for anesthesia will make certain kind of people choke. Finally, scientists found it was because they had certain kind of genes.
sentences.chinese: 例如，某种麻醉用肌肉松弛剂会导致特定的人无法呼吸，最终，科学家发现这种现象的原因在于他们拥有特定的基因。

sentences.english: Another Sierra is a Doctor of anatomy. He was credited fot inventing the first anesthetic. The anesthesia allowed him to operate on his patients without causing pain.
sentences.chinese: 另一位席埃拉是名解剖学博士。他被誉为发明麻醉药的第一人。在麻醉作用下，他可以为病无痛做手术。

name: exhibit
trans: vt. 展览；显示；提出（证据等） n. 展览品；证据；展示会 vi. 展出；开展览会

sentences.english: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

detailed_translations.english: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

name: giraffe
trans: n. 长颈鹿

sentences.english: I/ you/ we/ they like giraffe.
sentences.chinese: 我/你/我们/他们喜欢长颈鹿。

sentences.english: So they sent me a … giraffe!
sentences.chinese: 于是他们又送我一只…长颈鹿。

sentences.english: Can I get the mommy giraffe for Christmas?
sentences.chinese: 我在圣诞节能得到一个长颈鹿妈妈吗？

detailed_translations.english: a tall African animal with a very long neck and legs and dark spots on its yellow-brown fur

name: hoofed
trans: adj. 有蹄的；装蹄的；蹄形状的 v. 用蹄踢；步行（hoof的过去分词）
